titleStmt.title: Elizabeth Jane, Lady Charlemont reads “Break, Break, Break” to Tennyson, 1871
titleStmt.author: Phyllis Weliver

availability.p: Freely available on a non-commercial basis.

projectDesc.p: Essay generated for the Sounding Tennyson project, creating an interactive exhibit for exploring resources and research around the poems and music of Tennyson.

body.p: Mrs Greville, Lady Charlemont, Mr Locker, & Admiral Englefield come to luncheon. A [Alfred] & Hallam have called on Mrs Hodgson in the morning & asked her to meet Mrs Greville in the afternoon. She & her sister Miss Forsyth come. A [Alfred] reads Boadicea & part of Maud to them & Lady Charlemont recites or rather acts the Sisters after A [Alfred] has at her request read it & then she reads Break break break. [space] All have tea & go, except Mr Locker, just as Mr & Mrs Farrar arrive.

rr-bib-entry.rr-footnote: Emily Tennyson, 30 June 1871, Diary, vol. 2, f 180, TRC/M50. Lincolnshire County Council, UK.
